info.description: This API lets you interact with a RSK client via JSON-RPC
info.title: RSK JSON-RPC

methods.name: eth_blockNumber
methods.summary: Returns the number of most recent block.

methods.name: eth_call

result.description: The return value of the executed contract

methods.summary: Executes a new message call (locally) immediately without creating a transaction on the block chain.

methods.description: Returns the currently configured chain id, a value used in replay-protected transaction signing as introduced by **EIP-155**.
methods.name: eth_chainId

result.description: hex format integer of the current chain id. Defaults are `Mainnet=30`, `Testnet=31`
result.name: chainId

methods.name: eth_coinbase

result.description: The address owned by the client that is used as default for things like the mining reward
result.name: address

methods.summary: Returns the client coinbase address.

methods.description:
Generates and returns an estimate of how much gas is necessary to allow the transaction to complete. The transaction will not be added to the blockchain. Note that the estimate may be significantly more than the amount of gas actually used by the transaction, for a variety of reasons including EVM mechanics and node performance. 

 See `eth_call` parameters, expect that all properties are optional. If no gas limit is specified geth uses the block gas limit from the pending block as an upper bound. As a result the returned estimate might not be enough to executed the call/transaction when the amount of gas is higher than the pending block gas limit.
methods.name: eth_estimateGas

result.description: The amount of gas used
result.name: gasUsed

methods.summary: Calculates an estimate of how much gas is necessary to allow the transaction to complete

methods.name: eth_gasPrice
methods.summary: Returns the current price per gas in wei

methods.name: eth_newBlockFilter
methods.summary: Creates a filter in the node, to notify when a new block arrives. To check if the state has changed, call eth_getFilterChanges.

methods.description:
To check if the state has changed, call `eth_getFilterChanges`.

**A note on specifying topic filters**:
Topics are order-dependent. A transaction with a log with topics `[A, B]` will be matched by the following topic filters:

`[]` anything
`[A]` A in first position (and anything after)
`[null, B]` anything in first position AND B in second position (and anything after)
`[A, B]` A in first position AND B in second position (and anything after)
`[[A, B], [A, B]]` (A OR B) in first position AND (A OR B) in second position (and anything after)
methods.name: eth_newFilter

result.description: The filter ID for use in `eth_getFilterChanges`
result.name: filterId

methods.summary: Creates a filter object, based on filter options, to notify when the state changes (logs).

methods.description: To check if the state has changed, call `eth_getFilterChanges`.
methods.name: eth_newPendingTransactionFilter
methods.summary: Creates a filter in the node, to notify when new pending transactions arrive.

methods.name: eth_sendRawTransaction

result.description:
The transaction hash, or the zero hash if the transaction is not yet available.

Use `eth_getTransactionReceipt` to get the contract address, after the transaction was mined, when you created a contract.
result.name: transactionHash

methods.summary: Creates new message call transaction or a contract creation for signed transactions.

methods.name: eth_sendTransaction

result.description:
The transaction hash, or `zero` hash if the transaction is not yet available.

Use `eth_getTransactionReceipt` to get the contract address, after the transaction was mined, when you created a contract.
result.name: transactionHash

methods.summary: Creates new message call transaction or a contract creation, if the data field contains code.

methods.description:
The sign method calculates an Ethereum specific signature with: `sign(keccak256("\x19Ethereum Signed Message:\n" + len(message) + message)))`.

By adding a prefix to the message makes the calculated signature recognisable as an Ethereum specific signature. This prevents misuse where a malicious DApp can sign arbitrary data (e.g. transaction) and use the signature to impersonate the victim.

**Note** the address to sign with must be unlocked.
methods.name: eth_sign

result.description: The signed message
result.name: signedMessage

methods.summary: Calculates an Ethereum specific signature

startingBlock.title: syncingDataStartingBlock

oneOf.title: syncingData

methods.summary: Returns an object with data about the sync status or false.

methods.description: Additionally Filters timeout when they aren't requested with `eth_getFilterChanges` for a period of time.

Block.description: The Block is the collection of relevant pieces of information (known as the block header), together with information corresponding to the comprised transactions, and a set of other block headers that are known to have a parent equal to the present blocks parents parent.

Bytes.description: Hex representation of a variable length byte array
